description.p: While attuned to this item and wielding it, the bearer can cast An Eye for an Eye and A Tooth for a Tooth once per long rest.

p.em: War leaves its marks on everyone who sees it. Some take scars that never heal. So did the leves that had to kill their companions that turned against them during the Titan's war. Their sorrow and their friends' blood drenched these weapons, granting them innate necrotic powers.

description.p: This tribal sword's sturdy wooden frame is lined with obsidian shards, allowing attacks made with it to deal either bludgeoning or slashing damage (your choice).

The sword has been enchanted through the heartbreaking slaughter of friends turned foes. When you roll a 20 on your attack roll with this magic weapon against a creature, that creature becomes marked for death until the start of your next turn. A marked creature can't regain hit points, does not feel pain, and when the mark ends, takes 1d8 necrotic damage.

p.em: Shattered jaws may heal in time, but some betrayals fester and poison the soul.

description.p: This translucent dagger is made of magically reinforced glass. A hidden intricate contraption in its handle makes it usable as a syringe. It takes a minute to carefully fill the syringe with a liquid. Poison inside the vial maintains its potency for 24 hours. As part of an attack with the dagger, after you hit, as a free action, you may activate the hidden contraption to release all its content in the target. All saving throws against poisons delivered this way have their DC increased by 1. Additionally, if the vial is empty, this dagger may be used to harvest venom or blood from a creature providing advantage on the check when used in conjunction with a poisoner's kit.

p.em: Every life, whether human, beast, or plant, must come to an end. It's all temporary. Everything has its own grim reaper, and today, I'm ready to reap what's been sown.

description.p: This wildlands explorer's heirloom depicts wheat and field designs and is so well crafted is has the finesse property. When you hit a plant creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 slashing damage. In addition, any nonmagical plant harvested with this sickle magically remains fresh for an extra 7 days.

p.em: Gnomes pride themselves for works of art and craftmanship that are ingenuously useful during their lifetime. Dwarves strive to build eternally magnificent figurative masterpieces. This creation is a tribute to both their traditions, emulating the phoenix the repeatedly burns gloriously during his never-ending cycles of life and death. What a poetic heirloom to pass from generation to generation.

description.p: This magic sword is made of emberwood, a dark tree that grows only in volcanic regions where the lava veins flow like water beneath the ground. It looks like a regular wood but is as hard as steel and requires years of training to smith, let alone craft intricate details and imbue it with magic. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

Phoenix Dance. As a bonus action, you can speak this sword command word to make the magic sap within the wood ignite the blade for 1 minute or until you dismiss it (no action required). Once you activate the flames within the sword, you can't do it again until the next dawn. When you hit a creature with this magic sword while it is lit, the creature takes an extra 1d4 fire damage. In addition, the magic flames surrounding the sword turn even defensive movements, a threat to the enemies around you. Whenever a creature that is 5ft from you misses you with an attack roll, it takes 1d4 fire damage.

Phoenix Might. While holding this sword, you can use it as a spellcasting focus. Spells that deal fire damage cast through this focus have a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to their saving throw DCs. Casting a spell that deals fire damage through this sword cause it to inflame at the end of the next X rounds or until it hits a target, dealing an additional Xd4 fire damage on hit, whichever comes first. X equals the level of the spell cast.
While the sword is ablaze by any effect, it shines bright light it a 20-foot radius and dim light in an additional 20 feet.
